Uses of Class
distances.kernel.Kernel

    Package Description
    configuration  
    data.representation  
    distances.kernel

    • Uses of Kernel in configuration

      Fields in configuration declared as Kernel 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Kernel BatchClusteringConfig.ker 

    • Uses of Kernel in data.representation

      Methods in data.representation with parameters of type Kernel 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float[][] DataSet.calculateKernelMatrixMultThr(Kernel ker, int numThreads)
      Calculates the kernel matrix in a multi-threaded way.

    • Uses of Kernel in distances.kernel

      Subclasses of Kernel in distances.kernel 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  ANOVAKernel
      Sum over all dimensions of: exp(-sigma*(x_i-y_i)^2)^d.
      class  CauchyKernel
      The Cauchy kernel comes from the Cauchy distribution (Basak, 2008).
      class  ChiSquaredKernel 
      class  CircularKernel
      The circular kernel is used in geostatic applications.
      class  ExponentialKernel
      The difference between this and the Gaussian Kernel is that the norm is not squared.
      class  GaussianKernel 
      class  GeneralizedHistogramKernel
      The Generalized Histogram Intersection kernel is built based on the Histogram Intersection Kernel for image classification but applies in a much larger variety of contexts (Boughorbel, 2005).
      class  GeneralizedTStudentKernel 
      class  InverseMultiQuadraticKernel
      The Inverse Multi Quadric kernel.
      class  LaplacianKernel
      Exponential, but less sensitive to sigma.
      class  LogKernel
      The Log kernel seems to be particularly interesting for images, but is only conditionally positive definite.
      class  MinKernel
      The Histogram Intersection Kernel is also known as the Min Kernel and has been proven useful in image classification.
      class  MultiQuadraticKernel
      The Multiquadric kernel can be used in the same situations as the Rational Quadratic kernel.
      class  PolynomialKernel
      K(x,y) = (slope * xTy + c)^d
      class  PowerKernel
      The Power kernel is also known as the (unrectified) triangular kernel.
      class  RationalQuadraticKernel
      The Rational Quadratic kernel is less computationally intensive than the Gaussian kernel and can be used as an alternative when using the Gaussian becomes too expensive.
      class  RBF
      e^(-gamma * |x-y|^2)
      class  SigmoidKernel
      tanh(slope * xTy + c)
      class  SphericalKernel
      The spherical kernel is similar to the circular kernel, but is positive definite in R3.
      class  SplineKernel
      The Spline kernel is given as a piece-wise cubic polynomial, as derived in the works by Gunn (1998).
      class  TranslationInvariantWaveletKernel
      This class implements the translation invariant wavelet kernel.
      class  WaveKernel
      The Wave kernel is also symmetric positive semi-definite (Huang, 2008).

    • Uses of Kernel in learning.unsupervised

      Methods in learning.unsupervised with parameters of type Kernel 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static java.util.ArrayList<ClusteringAlg> ClustererFactory.getAllClusterers(DataSet dset, int k, float[][] distMat, NeighborSetFinder nsf, float[][] trainingKernelMat, NeighborSetFinder nsfKernel, int nClust, CombinedMetric cmet, Kernel ker)
      This method generates all supported clusterers representing different algorithms, for the given data.
      static ClusteringAlg ClustererFactory.getClustererForName(java.lang.String cName, DataSet dset, int k, float[][] distMat, NeighborSetFinder nsf, float[][] trainingKernelMat, NeighborSetFinder nsfKernel, int nClust, CombinedMetric cmet, Kernel ker)
      This is how initial clusterer instances are currently generated, as they require initial parametrizations and doing all of that via reflection in every single case might be somewhat non-trivial in the general case - though it is certainly preferable to having the algorithm names hardcoded inside.
